column1: Just as he will not tolerate questions about his private life, so he will also go ballistic if bureacrats attempt to meddle in his creative decisions — something which Pierre Berge ( the chairman of Yves Saint Laurent ) found out when he became superintendent of Paris's opera houses in 1988 and attempted to take Barenboim on over the conductor's directorship of the new Opera - Bastille.
